alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kimball and southeastern Banner Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Oliver Reservoir, or 9 miles northwest of Kimball, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix and Bushnell. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
